Please help |This article is part of |[Alternative medicine](/wiki/Alternative_medicine) In [alternative medicine](/wiki/Alternative_medicine), bodywork is any therapeutic or development](/wiki/Personal_development) technique that involves working with the [human body](/wiki/Human_body) [energy medicine](/wiki/Energy_medicine). Bodywork to assess or improve [posture](/wiki/Posture_and_occupational_health), promote [awareness](/wiki/Self-awareness#Psychology) of the " [bodymind connection](/wiki/Bodymind)" which is an approach that sees the human body and mind as a single integrated unit, or to manipulate the [electromagnetic field](/wiki/Aura_(paranormal)) alleged to surround the human body and affect health. [[1]](#cite_note-Gale-1) Forms[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Bodywork_(alternative_medicine)&action=edit§ion=1)] Some of the best bodywork methods include: [qigong](/wiki/Qigong), [t'ai chi](/wiki/T%27ai_chi_ch%27uan). The better known There are also some methods that use light touch (not tissue work) to retrain movement patterns or shift awareness of the body, including the [Alexander technique](/wiki/Alexander_technique), is deep tissue [massage therapy](/wiki/Massage_therapy), and the terms massage and bodywork are often used interchangeably. While bodywork includes all forms of massage techniques, it also includes many other types of touch therapies. [[3]](#cite_note-Cassar-3) Statistics in the United States[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Bodywork_(alternative_medicine)&action=edit§ion=3)] According to a 2002 survey of adults in the United States by the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Medicine (NCCIH) and the [National Center for Health Statistics](/wiki/National_Center_for_Health_Statistics) (NCHS): [[4]](#cite_note-NCCIH2004-4) [Acupuncture](/wiki/Acupuncture)was used by 4.0% of the population, with 1.1% having used it in the last year. [Chiropractic](/wiki/Chiropractic)was used by 19.9% of the population, with 7.5% having used it in the last year. - Deep breathing exercises were used by 14.6% of the population, with 11.6% having used the technique in the last year. [Yoga](/wiki/Yoga)was used by 7.5% of the population, with 5.1% having used it in the last year. [T'ai chi](/wiki/T%27ai_chi_ch%27uan)was used by 2.5% of the population, with 1.3% having used it in the last year. [Qigong](/wiki/Qigong)was used by 0.5% of the population, with 0.3% having used it in the last year. [Energy healing](/wiki/Energy_medicine)and [reiki](/wiki/Reiki)were used by 1.1% of the population, with 0.5% having used it in the last year. See February 2014.
